description: Inverse of the permutation A054073 of N.
comments: When formatted as a rectangular array, row n gives the positions of n in A054073; the array is an interspersion.  (Each pair of rows eventually intersperse.)
mathematica: r = Sqrt[2];t[n_] := Table[FractionalPart[k*r], {k, 1, n}];f = Flatten[Table[Flatten[(Position[t[n], #1] &) /@ Sort[t[n], Less]], {n, 1, 20}]] (* A054073 *)TableForm[Table[Flatten[(Position[t[n], #1] &) /@ Sort[t[n], Less]], {n, 1, 15}]]row[n_] := Position[f, n];u = TableForm[Table[row[n], {n, 1, 20}]]g[n_, k_] := Part[row[n], k];p = Flatten[Table[g[k, n - k + 1], {n, 1, 13}, {k, 1, n}]] (* A054077 *)q[n_] := Position[p, n]; Flatten[ Table[q[n], {n, 1, 80}]]  (* A054076 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
